intro: Tepuianthus colombianus, commonly known as the Colombian tepuianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
